result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) and Operating w/ PAC (4th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) was dismissed by the court.

  • James T Zimmerman was found guilty of OWI (4th), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Defendant James T Zimmerman in court with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 9:56 a.m. Motion to grant credit for jail time. Court reviews case. Statement by D.A., believes testimony not needed due to case law, however,would still like to take some testimony to support arguments. Response by the Court. Jail Administrator Donald Bergbower duly sworn on oath, testifies. Atty Schuster presents arguments. Arguments presented by the State. Response by Atty Schuster. Court asks Counsel if either found any other case law. None found by either. Additional arguments by State. Remarks by the Court. Discussion regarding appropriateness on proceeding with ruling. Recess 10:18. Resume 10:21. Court advises he did not save any notes from previous hearing. If either Counsel wishes the Court to recuse, he will do so. State would like a new judge assigned. The Court will sign a recusal order. Matter will be rescheduled when new judge is assigned.

Defendant James T Zimmerman in court with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 9:02 a.m. Motion to deem jail term served. Court has reviewed motion. Court reviews decision in another case with Counsel, finds to be a different situation. Atty Schuster presents background facts and arguments. State agrees with background facts, presents arguments. State feels evidentiary hearing needed. Court will recess for State to contact jail. Atty Schuster does not feel evidentiary hrg is necessary. Recess @ 9:13. Resume 9:30. State advises that the Jail Administrator is unavailable to testify. Court will grant adjournment in order to have witnesses available. Off the record for scheduling. Court will not order Def to start jail sentence pending hearing.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 18, 2017 at 09:30 am.
Motion hearing on April 26, 2017 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: Defendant James T Zimmerman in court with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 9:10 a.m. agreement stated - state moves to dismiss and consolidate ct 2, plea to ct 1 of second amended complaint OWI 4th,  225 days jail imposed and stayed, 3 yrs probation, 60 days jail, $4178 fine and costs, 32 month revocation, IID 32 months, AODA and follow through, counseling deemed necessary absolute sobriety, no possession or consumption of alcohol, DNA sample. Atty Schuster and Def agree. Plea quest. reviewed. Plea to ct 1 OWI 4th - guilty. Constitutional rights, elements - Def admits prior convictions - possible penalties reviewed. Atty Schuster satisfied. Court finds Def understands and plea freely & voluntarily made, grants motion to dismiss and consolidate ct 2 of second amended complaint. Factual basis. Court accepts plea and finds guilty of ct 1 OWI 4th. Sentencing remarks by State. BAC .401. Sentencing remarks by Atty Schuster. Statement by Defendant. Remarks by the Court, will follow agreement. 225 days jail, imposed and stayed, 3 yrs probation, 60 days jail, $1478 fine and costs includes DNA and IID surcharges, 32 month revocation, retroactive to any admin susp. IID 32 months, AODA and driver safety plan, absolute sobriety, attend any counseling deemed necessary, DNA sample. Report no later than 7 pm today, huber. No credit if revoked.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Apply bond to fine and costs. Postconviction rights. State gives Court statute for probation.

Defendant James T Zimmerman in court with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 3:00 p.m. Statement by Atty Bayne-Allison regarding information obtained on issue of records from State of Virginia. State will file amended complaint alleging OWI 4th. Court grants leave to do so.  Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant James T Zimmerman in court with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 9:25 a.m. Statement by Atty Schuster. Statement by Atty Bayne-Allison. Arguments on motion collaterally attacking Def's previous OWI convictions. Court will delay ruling and allow parties time to get additional information.  Further proceedings scheduled for August 4, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Supporting Motion Collaterally Attacking Defendant's Previous OWI Convictions
Collaterally Attacking Defendant's Previous OWI Convictions

Defendant James T Zimmerman in court with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint received, reviewed and waive reading.  Waive time limits for preliminary hearing.   Court explains preliminary time limits.  Def agrees to waive time limits.  Bond will continue with conditions  Status conference scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
No use of alcohol & no driving a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.

Defendant James T Zimmerman in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @ 9:30 am.   Def. has copy of amended complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights & given options. Def. heard on atty from Public Defender. State gives bond recommendations.  Court orders $300 cash bond w/conditions. Def. must be back by 11:00 am to post bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
